intro: Byrsonima laurifolia, commonly known as the Brazilian cherry or yellow mangaba, is a tropical tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its glossy, lance-shaped leaves and showy yellow flowers. The tree produces edible fruits that are rich in nutrients, including vitamin C and antioxidants. Its bark and leaves have also been used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. The plant thrives in humid, warm climates and is often found in lowland forests and along riverbanks.
